page.title: 15TRANSPORT,PILNING RAILWAY
page.content: A busy main line railway runs through 4 squares of the area carrying goods and passenger trains between S.Wales the S.West and the Midlands, all using the Severn Tunnel. Pilning Station is about 2 miles from the village. It is an unmanned halt with 2 platforms and a footbridge. A passing loop is used for freight to give way to passenger express and a siding is used for maintenance wagons and a water tank in case of fire in the Severn Tunnel. A second passing loop is now unused. Signals at the tunnel end control the passing loop and tunnel traffic. 3 trains in the morning and 2 in the evening halt at Pilning but only a few people use them.
